conversation.text:
Based on the user's preferences, I would recommend "The Godfather" by Francis Ford Coppola. 

This movie was released in 1972 and has since become a classic of cinema.

In this movie, we witness the rise of the Corleone crime family in New York City during the Prohibition era from 1920 to 1933.

The main characters in this movie are Michael Corleone (played by Al Pacino)), his two half-siblings, Gianni Corleone (played by James Caan)) and the head of the Corleone crime family, Tomlin Corleone (played by Robert Duvall)).

Throughout the movie, we witness Michael's journey from a naive young man to a ruthless and cunning gangster who has built himself a powerful crime family dynasty in New York City during the Prohibition era from 1920 to 1933.

The main themes of this movie include family loyalty and honor, gang violence and bloodshed, criminal activity and corruption, power struggle and conflict within families and businesses, personal responsibility and accountability, moral and ethical dilemmas, and the consequences of one's actions.

Based on your preferences and what you mentioned, I would recommend the following two movies:
1. "The Great Gatsby" (2013) - This movie is based on F. Scott Fitzgerald's novel of the same name. The story follows a wealthy man named Jay Gatsby who becomes obsessed with his former love, Daisy Buchanan. The movie features great performances by actors such as Leonardo DiCaprio and Tobey Maguire. It also has beautiful cinematography and an engaging plot that keeps you on the edge of your seat.
2. "Find Me Guilty" (2006) - This movie is based on the real-life criminal trial of Jack DiNorscio, who was known as "Jack the Rat." The story follows Jack DiNorscio, a low-level gangster who defended himself in court in what became the longest criminal trial in American judicial history. The movie features great performances by actors such as Ron Silver and Richard Portnow.
